title: Impeachment Article Against Trump to Be Delivered to Senate Monday
sub_head: ‘It will be a full trial; it will be a fair trial,’ says Democrat Leader Chuck Schumer
body:
WASHINGTON—House Speaker Nancy Pelosi (D., Calif.) said she would send the article of impeachment against former President Donald Trump to the Senate on Monday, triggering a second impeachment trial, but with no agreement yet between Republicans and Democrats on the details of the proceedings.
The House voted last week to impeach Mr. Trump, alleging he incited a mob that stormed the U.S. Capitol on Jan. 6. The violent events that day left five people dead.
The Democratic impeachment managers are “ready to begin to make their case to 100 Senate jurors through the trial process,” Mrs. Pelosi said in a brief statement Friday. The nine managers, who act as prosecutors in the case, will be led by Rep. Jamie Raskin of Maryland.
Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer (D., N.Y.) gave no guidance on how long the trial would last or whether the Senate could conduct other business as the trial is proceeding.
“It will be a full trial, it will be a fair trial,” he said Friday on the Senate floor.
